attributes.action: request Rotherham Social Services provides viable, affordable replacement services for those it has cut or else re-instates those services in their original form
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Rotherham Council has recently cut social service provisions, namely meals on wheels and laundry services. 

This has the following unacceptable consequences:

-causes 'choice' to come at a potentially doubled price - a customer may now  need a home care visit for 30mins to heat and serve or fetch a meal -thus paying  twice -once for the meal and again for the carer’s  visit. 
-it removes the 'choice' of having a daily hot meal served without having your privacy invaded for up to  30mins
-may encourage poor diets (ie carers being sent to take-aways, chips shops etc as they are close by and cheap) 
-places more expectation and strain on informal carers -contrary to law and policy that aims to ensure carers' wellbeing
-contributes to job losses at a time of economic crisis
-places service users at risk of abuse if they are turning to people whom have not been vetted to provide cheaper services for them 

and furthermore -there is NO alternative service to deal with laundry soiled through incontinence. This in particular will be pushed on to over-relied on families
Thus these services must be reinstated or else appropriate, affordable and genuinely choice-providing services must be created.
